Evolve any of the other networks tyes

This file defines a generic reaction network using either of the other network architectures. The functions in this file are designed to be used with the GA library that I have written. More...


Data Structures

struct  ReactionNetwork
 A generic network that can contain either a mass-action network, protein-interaction network, or gene-regulation network. More...

 use this function to make the GA use only one type of network. This is the same as setting one network type's probability to 1 and the others to 0 using setNetworkTypeProbability. Use before calling evolveNetworks.

 set the average network size of the initial population. Use before calling evolveNetworks. The "size" can mean different things for different types of networks. In general, it corresponds to the number of rows and columns in the stoichiometry matrix.

 print the reaction network. This function simply calls the print functions of one of the individual networks.

 get a copy of a network

 crossover two networks if they are of the same type. Otherwise, same as mutateNetwork

Detailed Description

This file defines a generic reaction network using either of the other network architectures. The functions in this file are designed to be used with the GA library that I have written.

This file defines the following functions that are required in the GA: 1) a struct that represents an "individual" 2) numerous functions that utilize the existing networks

The program using this file must define: 1) a function that returns the fitness of a network

Any of the functions in the library can be replaced using the setXXX functions

GAindividual must be a ReactionNetwork* casted as GAindividual
Returns:
GAindividual combination of the two input networks if same network type, otherwise just a mutant of the input network

GApopulation evolveNetworks ( int  ,
int  ,
int  ,
GACallbackFnc   
)

print the reaction network. This function simply calls the print functions of one of the individual networks.

Parameters:
int number of individuals in the initial population (use large number here)
int number of individuals in each successive population (use relatively small number for speed)
int number of generations for evolution
GACallbackFnc a callback function (optional, use 0 for none)
Returns:
GApopulation the final evolved population of networks

void setInitialNetworkSize ( int  ,
int   
)

set the average network size of the initial population. Use before calling evolveNetworks. The "size" can mean different things for different types of networks. In general, it corresponds to the number of rows and columns in the stoichiometry matrix.

Parameters:
int number of variables (e.g, species or genes)
int number of reactions (e.g, enzymatic or transcriptional)

void setNetworkType ( int   ) 

use this function to make the GA use only one type of network. This is the same as setting one network type's probability to 1 and the others to 0 using setNetworkTypeProbability. Use before calling evolveNetworks.

int type of the network, e.g. e.g. MASS_ACTION_NETWORK | PROTEIN_INTERACTION_NETWORK
